contains_no_content_of_requested_type.description: Set to true if the input text contains no bibliographic entries. Otherwise, set to false.

full_title.description: Complete official title in plain text, preserving archaic spelling, but without formatting elements such as brackets (e.g. []) or markdown symbols.

short_title.description: A concise title or reference name in plain text, without formatting elements such as brackets (e.g. []) or markdown symbols. Example: 'Art of Cooking'.

main_author.description: Primary author name as: First Name Middle Name(s) Last Name. Use 'Anonymous' if no author is attributed. Example: 'François Pierre de la Varenne'.

institutional_main_author.description: True if the main author is institutional (e.g. a comune, a chamber of commerce, etc .); false if not.

short_note.description: A concise 3-10 sentence note with additional historiographical information (content, authors, historical context, etc.) about this work in modern english. Set to null if no such information is given in the input text.

library_abbreviation.description: Abbreviation of the holding library or archive of the first known/surviving edition of the work. Use null if not mentioned. Example: 'UBA = Universiteitsbibliotheek Amsterdam'

volumes_overview.description: Brief summary of the work's volume structure (e.g., 'Three volumes: Vol. 1 (1645) original recipes; Vol. 2 (1783) expanded regional dishes; Vol. 3 (1978) facsimile reprint with modern annotations.'). Use null when the work is single-volume.

volume_numbers.description: Explicit enumeration of volume numbers if the source lists them; use null for confirmed single-volume works.

year.description: The year of publication. Use an integer or null if unknown. Example: 1751.

edition_number.description: Edition number (1,2,3...) or null if unknown.

volume_numbers.description: Ordered list of volume numbers covered by this edition. Use null if the edition pertains to a single-volume work or volumes are not indicated.

original_place.description: Place of publication exactly as given in the input text, preserving original spelling and language. Examples: 'Potsdam', 'Londini', or 'Venedig'. Use null if not provided.

original_region.description: Region, territory, or country of publication exactly as given in the input text, preserving original spelling and language. If explicitly stated, copy it as-is; otherwise, infer the most likely original_region from context when you are highly confident; otherwise use null. Examples: 'Preußen', 'England', or 'Regno di Napoli'. Use null if original_place is null.

modern_place.description: Place of publication as its modern English equivalent with modern English spelling, based on 2019 borders, suitable for programmatic matching. Examples: 'Potsdam', 'London', or 'Venice'. Can be deduced from context; use 'Unknown' if you cannot determine the modern equivalent; use null if original_place is null.

modern_region.description: Country of publication as its modern English equivalent with modern English spelling, based on 2019 borders, referring to the largest country-level geographic polity (e.g., 'United Kingdom' not 'England', 'Germany' not 'Bavaria'), suitable for programmatic matching. Examples: 'Germany', 'United Kingdom', or 'Italy'. Can be deduced from context; use 'Unknown' if you cannot determine the modern equivalent; use null if original_place is null.

publication_locations.description: Array of publication locations for this edition. Multiple entries indicate co-publication. Each entry captures the place and region as given in the source (original_place, original_region) alongside their modern English equivalents (modern_place, modern_region). The original_place field is the anchor: when it is null, all other fields (original_region, modern_place, modern_region) must also be null. If a region/country is not explicitly stated, original_region may be inferred from context when highly confident; otherwise it should be null.

name.description: Contributor name as: First Name Middle Name(s) Last Name. Use 'Anonymous' if contributor is anonymous.

role.description: Role of the contributor for this edition. Use null if unknown.

contributors.description: Contributors for this specific edition (editors, translators, etc.), including the main author. Use empty array if none.

edition_category.description: The category of the edition. Use a listed value, or null if the source omits it. Example: 'Original'.

language.description: Language of this edition. Use a listed value, can be deduced from context. Example: 'Italian'.

translated_from.description: The source language from which this edition was translated. Use a listed value, can be deduced from context. Use null if not translated. Example: 'French'.

format.description: Physical format of this edition. Use a listed value, or null if not provided.

pages.description: Total number of pages or leaf count for this edition, or null if unknown.

has_illustrations.description: True if this edition contains illustrations, plates, or engravings; false if it does not; null if unknown.

is_manuscript.description: True if this edition is handwritten (not printed); false if it is not; null if unknown.

price.description: Numeric price value. Example: 3.50. Use null if unknown.

currency.description: Currency abbreviation. Example: 'fr.' or '£'. Use null if unknown.

price_information.description: Historical or catalog price for this edition. Use null if not mentioned.

edition_info.description: Detailed information about each edition, including the first.
